snippet: John A. Catsimatidis, the billionaire businessman, picked up an endorsement by the Liberal Party, and Sal F. Albanese, a former city councilman, accused two rivals of misusing taxpayer dollars.
abstract: John A Catsimatidis, billionaire businessman running as outside candidate for mayor of New York, picks up endorsement of obscure but potentially influential Liberal Party; on Democratic side, Sal F Albanese, former Brooklyn city councilman, accuses better-known opponents Bill de Blasio and Christine C Quinn of hiring political operatives at taxpayer expense.

byline.contributor: David W. Chen and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: John A. Catsimatidis, the billionaire businessman, picked up an endorsement by the Liberal Party, and Sal F. Albanese, a former city councilman, accused two rivals of misusing taxpayer dollars.

headline.seo: 2 Outsiders in Mayor’s Race Make Bids to Irk Better Known Rivals
headline.main: Outsiders in Race for Mayor Are Irritating Their Better-Known Rivals
headline.print_headline: Outsiders in Race for Mayor Are Irritating Their Better-Known Rivals
